Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content:
Out of curiosity, about how much time (hrs) on average, does it take to add a project like BNB, an Ethereum based ERC20) project, or one in the Komodo Ecosystem?
Btw we are very appreciative of your hard work and very proud of the project.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I am not sure which blockchain tech BNB uses, so can't comment on that

adding  a Komodo Smart chain is just writing a json and submitting a PR to the coins repo <https://github.com/jl777/coins/blob/master/coins>
```json
{
    "coin": "LABS",
    "asset": "LABS",
    "fname": "KMD Labs",
    "rpcport": 40265,
    "txversion": 4,
    "overwintered": 1,
    "mm2": 1,
    "required_confirmations": 2
  }
```
adding erc20 is similar but, the contract has to be verified if it has all the necessary methods. most standard erc20 should be compatible

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: * electrum servers and explorer links should be submitted too

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: BNB is BEP2, which is Binance Chain token type (BEP2)

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: It is similar to Tendermint.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
we haven't integrated any tendermint protocol coins/tokens yet
so it will take a lot of time to implement the first one

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: What about bUSD

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Binance stablecoin

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: the current priority is to optimise the current working pairs

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: is bUSD erc20?

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: For sure. I was actually just curious on how long it takes you guys.

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: I'm been using it since initial beta and I'm trying to get an idea of the time and the effort, put into it.

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Let me check

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: I think you're right

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Lol CZ probably enjoys weighing down the Eth network

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: yeah, if it is ERC20 and has the required methods, it can be added very easily to the cli

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
> I'm been using it since initial beta and I'm trying to get an idea of the time and the effort, put into it.
we have ETH/erc20 and btc protocol (btc forks, zcash and its forks and komodo and its smart chains) swaps already implemented
so adding one of those is just adding their details to a file and doing a test swap

for new protocols, it is a completely different story
we need to get in touch with their developers and code their swap entirely from scratch. So, it depends

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: I'm extremely impressed.

Author: Privatoshi#9487
Content: Thanks for the hard work.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: @kmdkrazy when you have time and the amount of "Coin A" follow to the "b" address, see the address who received your "Coin A", and look up that address in "Coin B" explorer to see how much that address sent to a "b" address around the same time.

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: @gcharang   @Privatoshi BUSD is already implemented on atomicdex as its ERC20 token.

Author: Redman#2839
Content: Trying to understand what happens if I post a swap and the whole order isn't filled. Is the total sum reversed back to all parties that contributed ?

Author: Redman#2839
Content: Sorry for my naivety.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: No it stays up until fully filled

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: also, orders are individual, peer to peer, they do not add up into one order.
